"""
This module consists of classes that handles the main workflow.
"""

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)




[docs]
class Results(object):
    """ This is a class instatiated by the Project class using Project.retreive(QuerySet).
    This class contains the entries and helps to easily access the database to get the DatabaseAttibutes. """

    def __init__(self, entries):
        self.entries = entries

    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.entries)



[docs]
    def filter(self, **kwargs):
        results = self
        for k, v in kwargs.items():
            results = results._filter_single(keyword=k, value=v)
        return results



    def _filter_single(self, keyword, value):
        entries = [entry for entry in self.entries if getattr(entry.attributes, keyword) == value]
        return Results(entries=entries)

    @property
    def structures(self):
        return [entry.atoms for entry in self.entries]

    @property
    def attributes(self):
        return [entry.attributes for entry in self.entries]

    @property
    def connectivity(self):
        return [attr.connectivity for attr in self.attributes]

    @property
    def avg_coord_num(self):
        return [attr.avg_coord_num for attr in self.attributes]

    @property
    def id(self):
        return [entry.id for entry in self.entries]

    @property
    def energies(self):
        return [atoms.get_potential_energy() for atoms in self.structures]

    @property
    def dataframe(self):
        data_for_df = [{'id': entry.id, 'structure': entry.atoms.to_structure(),
                        'energy': entry.energy} | entry.attributes.to_dict() for entry in self.entries]
        df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(data_for_df)
        cols = ['id', 'structure', 'energy'] + list(self.entries[0].attributes.to_dict().keys())
        return df[cols]



[docs]
    def view(self):
        structures = self.structures
        if structures:
            # Instead of ase.visualize.view, use this method to allow writing of id to the GUI title
            images = Images()
            images.initialize(structures, filenames=[f'id{i}' for i in self.id])

            try:
                gui = GUI(images)
            except TclError:
                pass
            else:
                # Allow CatPlat to exit while the GUI remains running in the background
                p = EverLastingProcess(target=gui.run, daemon=False)
                p.start()





[docs]
    def write_csv(self, filename='data.csv'):
        """ Note: Does not check if file exists, as that may easily lead to race conditions."""
        self.dataframe.to_csv(filename, index=False)





[docs]
    def write(self, db_file):
        db = Database(db_path=db_file)
        for atoms, attributes in zip(self.structures, self.attributes):
            db.store(attributes=attributes, atoms=atoms)

    def join(self, *args, **kwargs):
        pass



    def __del__(self):
        pass






[docs]
class Project(object):
    """
    This is a boundary class in which the users interact with. This class contains user settings as
    mentioned in the attributes below.

    Args:
        name (str): Name of the pyatoms settings folder in .pyatoms/vasp.
        calculation_path (str): Directory of project folder.
        jobrunner (OverallJobRunner, FakeVaspOverallJobRunner): Jobrunner class that contains
            server information and how to run VASP.
        num_job_run_slots (int): Number of jobs to run in parallel.
        auto_create_folders (bool): Flag to automatically create calculation and database folders.
        ml_preoptimization (bool): Flag to use machine learning preoptimization. Default is False.
    """

    def __init__(self, name, jobrunner, calculation_path, database_path, output_writer=None,
                 num_job_run_slots=1, auto_create_folders=True, ml_preoptimization=False, test=False,
                 ml_potential_hash=None, skip_materials_project=False):

        # Ceate calculation folder
        if not os.path.exists(calculation_path):
            if auto_create_folders:
                os.makedirs(calculation_path)
            else:
                raise FileNotFoundError(f'{calculation_path} does not exist')

        # Create database folder
        if not self.is_mysql_database(database_path):
            database_folder = os.path.dirname(database_path)
            if not os.path.exists(database_folder):
                if auto_create_folders:
                    os.makedirs(database_folder)
                else:
                    raise FileNotFoundError(f'{database_folder} does not exist')

        self.auto_create_folders = auto_create_folders
        self.num_job_run_slots = num_job_run_slots
        self.output_writer = output_writer
        self.name = name
        self.calculation_path = calculation_path
        self.database_path = database_path
        self.jobrunner = jobrunner
        self.ml_preoptimization = ml_preoptimization
        self.ml_potential_hash = ml_potential_hash
        self.skip_materials_project = skip_materials_project

        self.test = test



[docs]
    def save(self, config_dir):
        settings = self.settings()
        settings.save(config_dir=config_dir)





[docs]
    def settings(self):
        return ProjectSettings(name=self.name, calculation_path=self.calculation_path, database_path=self.database_path)





[docs]
    @staticmethod
    def is_mysql_database(database_path):
        return 'mysql' in database_path





[docs]
    def database(self, path=None):
        if path is None:
            path = self.database_path
        return Database(db_path=path)



    def _create_tmp_calculation_folder(self):
        return tempfile.mkdtemp()

    def _create_tmp_database(self):
        if self.is_mysql_database(self.database_path):
            mysql_database = MySQLDatabase.from_path(self.database_path)
            tmp_db = tempfile.mkstemp(suffix='.db')[-1]
            mysql_database.to_file(tmp_db, append=True)
        else:
            name = os.path.splitext(self.database_path)[0]
            tmp_db = f'{name}_{random_string(n=6)}.db'
            with suppress(FileNotFoundError):
                shutil.copy(src=self.database_path, dst=tmp_db)
        return tmp_db

    @property
    def num_nodes(self):
        try:
            return self.jobrunner.num_nodes
        except:
            return 0

    @property
    def _project_settings(self):
        return YamlVaspProjectSettings.from_project_name(self.name)



[docs]
    @contextmanager
    def test_mode(self, cleanup=True):
        old_database_path, old_calculation_path = self.database_path, self.calculation_path
        self.database_path, self.calculation_path, self.test = self._create_tmp_database(), \
            self._create_tmp_calculation_folder(), \
            True

        try:
            yield self
        finally:
            if cleanup:
                with suppress(FileNotFoundError):
                    os.remove(self.database_path)

                with suppress(FileNotFoundError):
                    shutil.rmtree(self.calculation_path)

            self.database_path, self.calculation_path, self.test = old_database_path, \
                old_calculation_path, \
                False





[docs]
    def retrieve(self, query_set, calculate=True) -> Results:
        database_path = self.database_path
        calculation_path = self.calculation_path
        queries = query_set.to_queries()

        if calculate:
            logger.debug('Start calculations.')
            self._calculate(query_set=query_set, database_path=database_path, calculation_path=calculation_path)
            logger.debug('Finished calculating.')

        results = self._retrieve_from_database(queries, database_path)
        return results



    def _retrieve_from_database(self, queries, database_path):
        entries = []
        db = self.database(path=database_path)

        for query in queries:
            query = query.copy()
            if query.relaxed is None:
                query.relaxed = True
            entries += [db.retrieve(query=query, filter_ignored=True)]
        return Results(list(chain.from_iterable(entries)))

    def _blueprint_from_query(self, query_set, database_path, calculation_path):
        return WorkflowBlueprint(query_set=query_set, calculation_folder=calculation_path,
                                 database_path=database_path, ml_preoptimization=self.ml_preoptimization,
                                 ml_potential_hash=self.ml_potential_hash,
                                 skip_materials_project=self.skip_materials_project)

    def _create_hts(self, query_set, query_only, database_path, calculation_path):
        blueprint = self._blueprint_from_query(query_set, database_path, calculation_path)
        return HighThroughputScreening(blueprint=blueprint,
                                       num_job_run_slots=self.num_job_run_slots,
                                       jobrunner=self.jobrunner,
                                       query_only=query_only,
                                       project_settings=self._project_settings,
                                       output_writer=self.output_writer)

    def _calculate(self, query_set, database_path, calculation_path):
        hts = self._create_hts(query_set, query_only=False, database_path=database_path,
                               calculation_path=calculation_path)
        return hts.start()



[docs]
    @classmethod
    def from_folder(cls, name, folder, calculation_folder='calculations', database_folder='database', **kwargs):
        """
        Default calculation path: <folder>/calculations
        Default database path: <folder>/database/project.db
        """
        calculation_path = os.path.join(folder, calculation_folder)
        database_path = os.path.join(folder, database_folder, 'project.db')
        return cls(name=name, calculation_path=calculation_path, database_path=database_path, **kwargs)





[docs]
    @classmethod
    def for_testing(cls, **kwargs):
        from catplat.settings.user import DEFAULT_USER_TEMP_DIR
        from catplat.settings.constants import TEST_PROJECT_NAME
        from pyatoms.jobs.vasp.runner import FakeVaspOverallJobRunner

        calculation_path = os.path.join(DEFAULT_USER_TEMP_DIR)
        database_path = os.path.join(DEFAULT_USER_TEMP_DIR, 'project.db')

        jobrunner = FakeVaspOverallJobRunner(complete=True)

        return cls(name=TEST_PROJECT_NAME, jobrunner=jobrunner, calculation_path=calculation_path,
                   database_path=database_path, test=True, **kwargs)








[docs]
class HighThroughputScreening(object):
    """ This class is the main entry point to the high throughput screening"""

    def __init__(self, blueprint, num_job_run_slots, jobrunner, project_settings, output_writer=None,
                 query_only=False):
        self.blueprint = blueprint
        self.num_job_run_slots = num_job_run_slots
        self.jobrunner = jobrunner
        self.query_only = query_only
        self.project_settings = project_settings
        self.output_writer = output_writer

    def _material_job(self):
        return MaterialJob.from_blueprint(folder=self.blueprint.calculation_folder,
                                          blueprint=self.blueprint,
                                          query_only=self.query_only,
                                          project_settings=self.project_settings,
                                          output_writer=self.output_writer)



[docs]
    def start(self):
        job_processes, job_queue_manager = self._start_queue_managers()

        material_job = self._material_job()
        material_job.run(jobrunner=self.jobrunner, queue_manager=job_queue_manager)

        self._close_queue_managers(job_processes, job_queue_manager)
        return material_job.starting_workflows



    def _close_queue_managers(self, job_processes, job_queue_manager):
        job_queue_manager.close_queue()
        job_queue_manager.join_processes(job_processes)

    def _start_queue_managers(self):
        job_queue_manager = JobProcessorManager(num_processes=self.num_job_run_slots,
                                                process_name='jobprocess',
                                                polling_interval=0.1)

        job_processes = job_queue_manager.start_processes()
        return job_processes, job_queue_manager






[docs]
class MaterialJob(Job):
    def __init__(self, folder, blueprint, query_only, project_settings, output_writer):
        super().__init__(folder=folder, run_on_queue=False)
        self.blueprint = blueprint
        self.query_only = query_only
        self.project_settings = project_settings
        self.output_writer = output_writer

    def __repr__(self):
        return f'{self.__class__.__qualname__}<blueprint={self.blueprint}>'

    @cached_property
    def starting_workflows(self):
        if self.blueprint.is_user_slab:
            return SlabWorkflow.from_blueprint(bulk_atoms=None,
                                               blueprint=self.blueprint,
                                               query_only=self.query_only,
                                               project_settings=self.project_settings,
                                               output_writer=self.output_writer)
        else:
            return BulkStructureWorkflow.from_blueprint(blueprint=self.blueprint,
                                                        query_only=self.query_only,
                                                        project_settings=self.project_settings,
                                                        output_writer=self.output_writer)



[docs]
    def is_complete(self):
        return all([workflow.is_complete() for workflow in self.starting_workflows])



    def _run(self, jobrunner, queue_manager=None):
        # change from bulk_workflows to starting_workflows
        workflows = self.starting_workflows
        for workflow in workflows:
            workflow.run(jobrunner=jobrunner, queue_manager=queue_manager)

    def _compute_resources_required(self):
        return self._compute_units(num_units=0)



[docs]
    @classmethod
    def from_blueprint(cls, folder, blueprint, **kwargs):
        return cls(folder=folder, blueprint=blueprint, **kwargs)
